page.title: 08HARTLEY QUARRY
page.content: {Hartley Quarry}was opened in 1926 and covers 100 acres. It is now owned by { {Hargreaves Quarries }and it employs 44 men.{Mr G Sowerby }is the manager. {Limestone }is blasted from rock face with ammonia nitrate explosives. One ton of explosives can loosen 9000 ton of rock. Four mechanical diggers are used to pick up the stones. The lastest digger is powered by a 6 cylinder 4000 horse power diesel engine. It cost Â£100,000.Six dumpers carry the stones to the crusher where it is crushed and screened to varying sizes from 1 eigth to eight inches. Some of the limestone is heated to 1000 degrees C. in the lime kilns to produce quicklime.{Tarmac}is also produced at {Hartley Quarry. }The quarry sells it products in N England Scotland. Lime goes to{North Sea oil {rigs}and to {British Steel.}
